issues.description: The problem statement refers to REST endpoints under the "/api" prefix (e.g. PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents), but both the template and solution code (PersonResource) and the provided tests use endpoints without the "/api" prefix (e.g. PUT /persons/{personId}/parents). This mismatch will confuse students when implementing and testing the controllers.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the "/api" prefix from the problem statement when describing endpoints, or update the @RequestMapping in PersonResource to include "/api" so that mappings and tests align.

issues.description: The problem statement describes the web layer class as `PersonController`, but the template and solution define that controller class as `PersonResource`. This naming mismatch may confuse students searching for or extending the correct class.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename the class `PersonResource` to `PersonController` in the template and solution, or update the problem statement to refer to `PersonResource` instead of `PersonController`.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to a class named `PersonController` as the Web Layer entry point, but both the template and solution code define this REST controller as `PersonResource`. This mismatch may lead students to search for a non-existent `PersonController` and overlook the correct `PersonResource` class.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename references in the problem statement from `PersonController` to `PersonResource` (or rename the class in code to `PersonController`) so that the described component name matches the actual class name.

issues.description: The problem statement and requirements specify REST endpoints under the path `/api/persons/...`, but the template and solution map endpoints to `/persons/...` (missing the `/api` prefix). This inconsistency can confuse students when calling or testing the endpoints.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the base path for all endpoints: either add the `/api` prefix in `@RequestMapping` (e.g., `@RequestMapping(path = "/api", ...)`) or update the problem statement to use `/persons/...` without `/api`.
